fields.summary: Detect if disk attachments are enabled and require site credentials only if they are
Allow user to choose Default Assignee for component during import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64584].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When importing comments using the JSON importer it's not currently possible to specify comment visibility.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the importing of comment visibility.
 
h3. Workaround

Import the comments and then alter after importing.
fields.summary: Import comment visibility
JIM - allow to import by users other than global admins
Ability to map all fields during the import
Allow putting a symlink in JIRA_HOME/import/attachments to external directory
JIM doesn't allow mapping to fields that are limited to certain issue types
Import Pivotal sprints into GH sprints (not versions)
Not providing a required field to the CSV importer prevents import - more detailed error required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64577].
  {panel}

*Problem Defination*

Redmine Importer Plugin for JIM seems have yet to be updated for JIRA 7 and still at version 2.1.5

*Suggested Solution*

Provide the needed update to JIRA 7 users so that they will be able to import the issues from redmine 3.2.0
fields.summary: Redmine Importers Plugin JIM update JIRA 7.x
Bugzilla importer should allow users to map all issues to any issue types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64575].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently the CSV import does not allow for importing issue history.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide functionality to allow importing of issue history.
 
h3. Workaround 

As detailed in [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Importing+data+from+JSON], it is possible to import history using the JSON import.
fields.summary: As someone importing I want to be able to include issue history in CSV format
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a Mingle importer
Do not import unused users if external user management is turned on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64572].
  {panel}

Customer scenario: We had a user that wanted to use the csv importer to create new stories with "is a story in" link to an existing Feature (see attached "NewStoryImport.csv"). However, when using the csv importer, it only creates the link "stories" when creating a NEW Story to an EXISTING Feature – it creates the link backwards to what the user wants.


Steps to import:
# JIRA Admin -> System -> External System Import -> Import from Comm-separated values(CSV)
# Choose a file to import then to project
# At Map Field page when you link this new issue to existing issue, it only show Outward description list.
#* It will be great to list the Inward Description list or Allow to map link endpoints.
# Once imported it creates the link backwards.
fields.summary: Allow to list Inward Description list during mapping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64571].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When importing issues through CSV, the JIM will try to update, rather than create new issues under some circumstances (a match on an Issue Key, or External ID value). This might not always be desirable.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option to 'do not update existing issues' and instead create new issues for these entries within the CSV file.


h3. Workaround

When importing issues from CSV from an external service where a parent -> Child relationship exists between different entities a user must map the Issue Id and Parent Id's. 

These values are used and persisted within the External ID custom field.

Under some circumstances, it may not be desirable to persist this External ID longer term. Having this External ID allows for updating issues. 

You can consider removing this External ID from issues that you would not like to update through the JIRA CSV Import functionality provided by JIM.
fields.summary: Provide option to prevent updating existing issues when importing from External Systems
document that you can import CSV labels in 1 column
Make JSON Export complete and stable so it can be enabled by default
When mapping CSV fields it would be useful to have summary etc. at the top of the select list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64567].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIM will only reuse a Custom Field if it has a matching type as specified in table below. Any other cross-type imports will take no effect and will force JIM to create a new field.

|| Bugzilla Field || Expected Custom Field Type in JIRA ||
| bug_url | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:url |
| bug_severity | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select |
| priority | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select |
| status_whiteboard | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:text |
| Bugzilla Custom Field of type '2' | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select |
| Bugzilla Custom Field of type '3' | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiselect |
| Bugzilla Custom Field of type '4' | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textarea |
| Bugzilla Custom Field of type '5' | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime |
| Bugzilla Custom Field of type '6' | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield |
| Every other Bugzilla Custom Field Type | com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textfield |

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve Bugzilla text field import and allow to map this field to user-picket for example.
fields.summary: Improve Bugzilla text field import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64566].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The JIRA Importer enforces a connection to a MySQL Database that uses the InnoDB Engine. This can not be configured from the "Advanced" JDBC Settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Error occurs When attempting to connect to Mantis when using the JIRA Importer tool:
# Log into JIRA and goto the *External System Import* page.
# Select: *Import from Mantis*
# Attempt to connect to a MyISAM database
# Observe in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} the following exception:
{code}
com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLNonTransientConnectionException: Could not create connection to database server. Attempted reconnect 3 times. Giving up.

	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)

	at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:872)

	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.getInstance(ConnectionImpl.java:399)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.NonRegisteringDriver.connect(NonRegisteringDriver.java:325)

	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.JdbcConnection.validateConnection(JdbcConnection.java:235)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.AbstractDatabaseImporterController.createImportProcessBean(AbstractDatabaseImporterController.java:54)

	at com.atlassian.prettyurls.filter.PrettyUrlsCombinedMatchDispatcherFilter.doFilter(PrettyUrlsCombinedMatchDispatcherFilter.java:61)  <+13> (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:78) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:77) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:63) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (ProfilingFilter.java:99) (JIRAProfilingFilter.java:19) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (AbstractJohnsonFilter.java:71) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208)
	at org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.RuleChain.handleRewrite(RuleChain.java:176)

	at com.atlassian.analytics.client.filter.JiraAnalyticsFilter.doFilter(JiraAnalyticsFilter.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.analytics.client.filter.AbstractHttpFilter.doFilter(AbstractHttpFilter.java:32)  <+3> (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:78) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.prettyurls.filter.PrettyUrlsCombinedMatchDispatcherFilter.doFilter(PrettyUrlsCombinedMatchDispatcherFilter.java:61)  <+40> (DelegatingPluginFilter.java:78) (IteratingFilterChain.java:42) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:77) (ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:63) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:87) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (AbstractCachingFilter.java:33) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (AbstractEncodingFilter.java:41) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (PathMatchingEncodingFilter.java:49) (AbstractHttpFilter.java:31) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (JiraStartupChecklistFilter.java:79) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (MultipartBoundaryCheckFilter.java:41) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:87) (JiraFirstFilter.java:60) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:241) (ApplicationFilterChain.java:208) (StandardWrapperValve.java:220) (StandardContextValve.java:122) (AuthenticatorBase.java:501) (StandardHostValve.java:171) (ErrorReportValve.java:103) (StandardEngineValve.java:116) (AccessLogValve.java:950) (CoyoteAdapter.java:408) (AbstractHttp11Processor.java:1070) (AbstractProtocol.java:611) (JIoEndpoint.java:314)

Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Unknown storage engine 'InnoDB'
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.Util.handleNewInstance(Util.java:389)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:980)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3835)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3771)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2435)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2582)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2531)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1618)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1549)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.setSessionVariables(ConnectionImpl.java:5070)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.initializePropsFromServer(ConnectionImpl.java:3246)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.connectWithRetries(ConnectionImpl.java:2112)
	... 204 more
	{code}

h3. Expected Results
There should be a way to set the Engine type to MyISAM when importing issues. While it is important for JIRA to enforce the InnoDB Engine, this should not be the case when importing information from an External System.


h3. Actual Results

When connecting to the Mantis Server the {{atlassian-jira.log}} shows the connection string being used:
{code}
2015-01-01 01:01:01,001 http-bio-8080-exec-1 INFO admin 100x8908x1 idjmdi 192.168.0.2 /secure/admin/ImporterSetupPage.jspa [plugins.importer.web.JdbcConnection] Connecting to JDBC using connection string: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mantistest?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB&autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&zeroDateTimeBehavior=convertToNull&useCursorFetch=true&defaultFetchSize=100
{code}


h3. Workaround

The Importer will not able to work until the InnoDB engine is enabled the MySQL server. Therefore, enable the InnoDB Engine as per database vendor instructions.
fields.summary: Mantis importer unnecessarily requires InnoDB on source MySQL server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64565].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customers are trying to migrate from Codebase to JIRA.  At this time, there is not a native option to directly import from this other system and the CSV/JSON Import process requires significant modification to the data in order to make it compatible for importing. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a native import option from Codebase

h3. Workaround 
CSV/JSON Import

h5. Possible workaround:
If Codebase was used as a Code Repository, it may be possible to import the data into [BitBucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Import+or+convert+code+from+an+existing+tool] and then use JIM to do an Import from [BitBucket to JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Importing+data+from+Bitbucket].
fields.summary: Native JIRA Import from Codebase

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64564].
  {panel}

We could allow users to choose if they would like to have JIRA Issue Keys with the same numer as their external Issue ID/Key.

Now:
Issues are importer one after the other always starting from KEY-1
Real External Issue ID is saved in Custom Field "External ID"

Users are usually importing their external system (e.g. Bugzilla) to the new JIRA project, so we could try to force create JIRA issues with specified number in Issue Key.
fields.summary: Allow users to preserve Issue Id/Issue Keys from external systems

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64563].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Add Check or Warning for Created Dates set in the future


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Import a csv that has dates set in the future for created dates

h3. Expected Results
A warning should pop up to alert you to the fact that the dates are set in the future, and offer a click to proceed if desired.

h3. Actual Results
Issues will be created with dates set in the future.
fields.summary: Add Check or Warning for Created Dates set in the future
FogBugz Importer does not convert Subscribers to Watchers
Filter users that do not belong to a group or are imported to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64560].
  {panel}

Currently we import all users from Asana, which might be a bit of overhead.

As [~pborkowski] mentioned in PR:
{quote}
I guess this returns all workspaces in the destination Asna instance? We can be smart here - this method is used during import itself, but from the first step of wizard we know what project/workspaces were chosen for import - we can then extract users just from workspaces selected for import.

This should be somehow available from ConfigBean
{quote}

 

It looks a bit tricky from the code perspective.

With given APIs we should:
 # Get selected product names (mind there are 'special' project names).
 # Fetch all the project, for the given names.
 # Get workspace id's for the given names.
 # Fetch only users for the given worskpace ids.
fields.summary: Asana - import only project-related users
Create Issue History in JIRA when Importing Issues from Mantis
Native JIRA Import from Gemini
"Bug Import ID" is redundant compared to "Import Id"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64556].
  {panel}

Tested in CSV, but may be happening elsewhere.

We should inform the user that the configuration is wrong, in the same way we do for multiple columns with same header:
- if the field can receive multiple values, say nothing (and do as expected)
- if the field cannot receive multiple values, like Summary, display a warning and add fail messages if proceed (fail because we get data loss - user thinks he imported data from column X but it was discarded)
fields.summary: When I map multiple values to the same field only the first value is used and the other are SILENTLY ignored
When you type some project name in Add Project combo and this project does not exist you should be able to easily create it.
Ability to auto-mapping JIRA project with Bugzilla Project during second steps of importing process.
Include Category field to CSV importer
Native JIRA Import from Microsoft TFS
Map Mantis Categories as Issue Types
Allow mapping Mantis's Custom Field to existing JIRA's Custom Field
Add ability to choose which custom field to be imported
Add ability to filter imported issues based on simple criteria and perform partial project imports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64547].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The current Atlassian REST API Browser version is not compatible for JIRA 7.1.7. Customer have some users that require this plugin and used it very often.

h3. Suggestion
Release a compatible version for JIRA 7.1.7
fields.summary: Implement a compatible version of Atlassian REST API Browser plugin for JIRA 7.1.7
Issues might be imported with an arbitrary status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64545].
  {panel}

Currently the only missing piece for a proper import of Agile data (from JIRA Agile or other systems) is the inability to import Sprints.

While JSON importer can import Sprint assignments, it cannot import the Sprints themselves. 

Current REST API of JIRA Agile does not allow user to edit the Sprint status (as in started / in progress / ended)

A Sprint has these code properties that should be imported by JSON:
* Name (mandatory)
* Start Date (optional)
* End Date (optional)
* Status (mandatory, any of planned, running, ended)

I know that implementing this may require collaboration with GHS team, but don't ignore the importance of it, it does prevent others from migrating form their systems to JIRA+AGILE.
fields.summary: Allow proper import of Agile Sprints
Importer should try to guess mapped columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64543].
  {panel}

According to the CSV [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV#ImportingDatafromCSV-EncapsulatingJIRAdatastructureinyourCSVfile], you are able to update an existing issue by mapping the issue key on the CSV file to the JIRA field *Issue Key*.

However, if you want to update a subtask, you must map the issue key on the CSV file to the JIRA field *Issue ID*.  If you try to update a subtask, JIRA will throw the exception "n of n issues have been skipped because they already exist in destination projects."

!exist.png!

It would great to be able to update a subtask through CSV import.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to update an existing subtask through CSV import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64542].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Issues in Pivotal in the "Accepted" status should have their resolution set when being imported to JIRA.
h3. Suggested Solution

Set the *Resolution* to Done for issues in the 'Accepted' state.
h3. Workaround

Define a transition and bulk-edit Issues after the fact. For example, using steps similar to those in [How to Edit the Resolution of an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Edit+the+Resolution+of+an+Issue]
fields.summary: Set Resolution for "Accepted" Status during import from Pivotal Tracker
It should be possible to disable/post pone re-indexing
Allow non-admins to update issues via CSV

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64539].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Disabling the jira-importers-plugin causes the Software and Service Desk applications to disable. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to manage add-ons >> all add-ons
# Disable jira-importers-plugin

h3. Expected Results
The JIM plugin should be a system plugin and therefore not subject to being disabled.
h3. Actual Results
The JIRA Applications become disabled, and JIM is disabled as wel
 
h3.Workaround
Re-enable the JIM plugin, then re-enable the other plugins, or restart.
fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin needs to be system plugin
Create new links types on the fly during import
JSON (and others?) importer should accept compressed input
Make JIM compatible with Mantis on Microsoft SQL Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64535].
  {panel}

When a column name is repeated in imported CSV we allow mapping only to standard fields that can handle multiple values.
However, we allow selecting any (incompatible) custom field types.

We should limit the list of existing custom fields and possible types for new custom fields only to compatible ones.
Otherwise we get data loss, see JIM-457
fields.summary: When importing from CSV with repeated column names allow selecting only suitable custom fields
Support importing users from CSV by their Display Name
Import history data from Fogbugz
CSV update duplicates comments
Able to detect Flags field from Bugzilla
Add option to create users without group membership
Importer should import only users referenced (applicable) by selected projects for the import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64528].
  {panel}

in bugzilla you can have prodcuts with group rights.
i think the same applies for JIRA.

unfortunately currently the bugzilla importer does not obey the group rights.
As simple feature would be that

    * the correpsonding group gets created
    * all users belonging to the group get assigned to the group
    * the product gets assigned to the group
fields.summary: bugzilla importer does not obey group and rights
Worklog missing from export
Ability to map Comment Body through Non Admin CSV

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64521].

h3. Problem Definition
Current version of [Asana Importer Plugin for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-asana-plugin/server/versionhistory] doesn't support DataCenter. 

Version 1.0.5
JIRA Server 6.2 - 7.1.9
Released 2016-03-17

h3. Suggested Solution
 Enable support for JIRA DataCenter
fields.summary: Support JIRA datacenter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64520].
  {panel}

At the moment, it is possible for users to import a project when importing data from CSV file:
!scshot.png!

And when importing the project, it is possible for us to import project Components as well. However, apparently the CSV importer is missing the feature to allow user to specify the Component Lead from the CSV file. 

It will be great if the CSV importer allows us to specify component lead when importing project with components from CSV file. 

Sample CSV to import project, components and issues is attached to this request.
fields.summary: Add the ability to specify the Component Lead for components created via CSV file
Import Issue history from Redmine
Make sure that Importers documentation is updated
Native JIRA Import from Rally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64516].
  {panel}

JSON Exporter is not including issue links in the exported data.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create Issue A and Issue B
2. Create a link (any kind) between Issue A and Issue B
3. Go to issue A
4. Make JSON Export

Expected (Option 1.): Exported data contains Issue A and Issue B and link A->B
Expected (Option 2.): Exported data contains Issue A and link A->B

Actual: Exported data contains Issue A and no links.
fields.summary: JSON Export does not include Issue Links
Set Global Context for custom fields created

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
 1. Delete any "Story Point" from custom fields
 2. Create new custom field - Story point / Number field
 3. Create Agile sample demo project

Observed:
 - JIM is not reusing existing "Sotry Point" custom field. It is creating new one.
fields.summary: JIM creates new "Story Points" custom filed if "Story Points" is created manually before import

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64509].

Mantis Importer is ignoring three fields that are available in every Mantis project:
* Platform
* OS
* OS Version

These fields should be always imported as Custom Fields or allow user to pick destination field.
fields.summary: Mantis Importer is ignoring "Platform", "OS" and "OS Version" fields
Add support for Mantis in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64507].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customers are trying to migrate from Assembla to JIRA.  At this time, there is not a native option to directly import from this other system and the CSV Import process requires significant modification to the data in order to make it compatible for importing. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a native import option from Assembla

h3. Workaround 
CSV Import
fields.summary: Native JIRA Import from Assembla

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64506].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to import JIRA Service Desk SLA using CSV importer hence it would be great if there is a feature to do so.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to import JSD SLA custom field through CSV importer.
fields.summary: Provide a feature to import JSD SLA custom field
Improvements for Importer
Make it optional as to whether to map Category to Component/s when importing from Mantis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64503].
  {panel}

The OnBoarding process often takes longer than just moving from tracker A to tracker B in the precise point in time. The reason for that is people are often not sure if they even want to migrate in the first place. For that reason JIRA is offered as a try-and-buy product. And for the very same reason the issue importing process should also be spread in time.

As a user I would like to be able to continue using my old tracker and use JIRA at the same time before I decide to move to JIRA completely. During that time I expect:
* to modify the data in my legacy tracker and see these changes automatically progressing to JIRA
* to be able to modify the data in JIRA as well, but *I do not expect* the synchronisation to be also performed into my old tracker

so that I could get the better understanding of JIRA and gradually move over there when I am ready.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to set up JIM to periodically update my issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64502].
  {panel}

Users who are importing issues from an external system may not want to have an Agile board created automatically or users may want to choose which type of Agile board is created.


*Current behavior:*
Importer automatically creates a 'best suited for' Agile board automatically for the user

*Expected behavior*
Import wizard should offer a selection of Create: Scrum, Agile, Do not create an Agile board



*Workaround:*
Currently a customer can import external issues, create a new Agile board based on the new project, and then delete the Agile board they do not want to use.
fields.summary: Allow for the selection of Agile board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64500].
  {panel}

JIM does not allow to link two issues from different projects if they are not added in the single import.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to JSON Importer
2. Import corssProject.json
3. Wait until import is finished successfully
4. Go to JSON Importer
5. Import crossProject2.json
6. Import should finish correctly (right now it's raising bug that some External Issue IDs cannot be found)
fields.summary: Allow to link issues from two different imports
Include Comment Restriction on the Mantis Import
Create 3-way first on-boarding screen
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a AtTask importer
bugzilla importer does not obey private comments
CSV importer should allow default values for missing fields
Allow Trac Import module to read from a local file on server
Option for not overwrite certain field with default value while update existing issues with CSV
CSV Import does not import the "Date Updated" field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64488].
  {panel}

The importWorklog method of DefaultJiraDataImporter makes a call to
 
worklogManager.create(userProvider.getUser(externalWorklog.getAuthor()), worklog, null, false);

The method adds worklog to issue worklog and also adds an item to the history table. The worklog item is ok:

guena logged work - 01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent:2 hours 
Validate

However, the corresponding history item is not ok:

guena made changes - 8 hours ago 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]  

It should be like

guena made changes  01/Sep/14 8:01 PM 

Time Spent  3 hours, 5 minutes [ 11100 ]  5 hours, 5 minutes [ 18300 ]  
Worklog Id  11202 [ 11202 ]
fields.summary: worklogManager uses current date\time instead of supplied one for history
Allow import of Custom Fields from Fogbugz/Fogbugz OnDemand
JIM does not import comments added by correspondents (via incoming mail FB feature)
